result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: The QualitEE project will make relevant data accessible. This is also in line with the overall objective of the project â€“ increasing of trust in energy service providers and their services through transparency. Within the first 6 months a D1.8 Data Management Plan (M06) will be developed and updated in M18 and M30. This plan defines (1) what kind of data will be collected, (2) to whom it may be useful later on, (3) what standards will be developed or adopted, (4) how data will be shared and (5) archived in the long-term (implementation of a professional data repository tool as well as the QualitEE project website). Also (6) restrictions on data publication will be defined. It will be ensured that data (e.g. necessary primary data from interviews) will be available for 10 years or more where needed.

result.title: Documentation of social media or extra newsletter
result.description: Existing social media platforms will be used to disseminate project results on a regular basis. While Twitter and LinkedIn are widely used in western European countries, in the Central and Eastern Europe it is rarely used. It is therefore important to accommodate the different preferences in each partner country while communicating to the whole European community. A content calendar will be created at the start of the project with each partner identifying the most relevant social media channels (monthly postings) as well as existing company channels. The measurement of these activities will also be defined at the start of the project and a record will be kept within the internal reporting tool before each project meeting. Within the communication strategy (Task 6.3) partners will choose one of - Countries with high dissemination potential through social media will participate in the social media strategy implementation (monitoring quantitatively and qualitatively the efforts and successes). EEVS will establish and maintain a social media webpage(s) (e.g. linkedin and twitter) (decision to be taken in T6.3). - Countries where social media are not effective will promote the project among the national target groups will prepare additional three newsletters with 2 pages, to be disseminated via email. The social media activities and extra newsletters will be documented within D6.5 Documentation of social media or extra newsletter (M36).

result.title: Webinar 1
result.description: Webinars will be organised in the second year of the project, in order to further develop interest from relevant stakeholders, galvanize their involvement in the field and exploit the project results. A slot will be devoted to the use of the EeDaPP Portal. A first webinar will be organised at M20.

result.title: Project Management and Activity Report
result.description: Includes a detailed justification of the costs incurred and of the resources deployed by each contractor linking them to activities implemented and justifying their necessity, the financial statements from each contractor and a summary financial report consolidating the costs of the contractors. It contains a description of the activities carried out during the reporting period, an overview of the progress in relation to the project objectives, the progress towards the milestones and deliverables set for the period, and any problems encountered and corrective actions taken. It also includes a publishable executive summary and an updated Plan for using and disseminating the knowledge.

result.title: Project Website
result.description: Create and maintain a Project web site on a .EU domain that will be regularly updated. This will offer general information about the Project, its partners and the H2020 Programme. It informs about previous and forthcoming events and activities of the Project as well as other relevant news on Project topics. EeMAP website is used for the internal Consortium (Reserved Area), for dissemination towards stakeholders (Registered Area &Project Platform) and for public dissemination (Public Area).

result.description: Overview per country of energy consumption in the agro-food sector, potential measures for achieving energy savings in the agro-food sector, data (if any) on the status of implementing these measures, and an estimate of potential impact if all measures are taken. This report will be used as baseline to estimate the (potential) impacts leveraged by this project, which will be calculated in WP5 and included in D5.3.

result.title: Report on the SPREM methodology and supporting tools to be developed
result.description: â€¢ Mapping of current SPREM approaches in other countries: o Desk research on recent research and other publications, o Interviews with SPREM managers in front running municipalities (e.g. Rotterdam, Amsterdam, Utrecht in the Netherlands, â€¦). â€¢ Analysis and assessment of current real estate management practices in Belgium: o Interviews with public real estate managers of three municipalities that are considered as â€˜best in classâ€™ regarding real estate management (e.g. City of Antwerp), o Interviews with public real estate managers of three municipalities that can be considered as representative for the target group, o Review of the SPREM approach of The Facility Company itself. â€¢ Development of the most appropriate SPREM approach for Public Clients: o Development of the general SPREM approach, o Adaptation of SPREM to specific Public Clients groups: Municipalities with a large Real Estate portfolio, Municipalities with a medium Real Estate portfolio, Municipalities with a small Real Estate portfolio, Public Clients at the Flemish Regional Level. o Development of the SPREM implementation roadmap. â€¢ Defining data and information requirements: o Defining data and information requirements for SPREM, o Defining data and information requirements at a strategic level, o Development of SPREM Performance Indicators, o Development of the requirements of the SURE2050 platform, â€¢ Review of methodology: o Development of a review checklist that will be used during the coaching, o Development of a questionnaire for Public Clients, o Analysis of methodology based on feed-back of Public Clients and internal evaluation, o Adaptation of methodology.

result.title: Report on the training methodology
result.description: â€¢ Development of the most appropriate training approach: o Assessment of the different training approaches and the pros and cons of each approach, o Compatibility with the SPREM methodology (Task 3.1) and its impact on training topics and approach, o Development of the approach for Public Clients at the political level, o Development of the approach for SPREM coordinators and other managers, o Investigate synergies between the trainings to both target groups, o Review and adaptation of trainings.
